Hermon-Hodge, D.S.C., R.N., Assistant Secretary.1.16182] Provisional Minutes* of the 227th Meeting of the Committee of Imperial Defence,held on May 20, 1927.REDUCTION AND LIMITATION OF NAVAL ARMAMENTS: FORTHCOMING CONFERENCE OF .NAVAL POWERS.(Previous Reference: C.I.D. Minutes of the 222nd Meeting, Minute 1 (C).)THE FIRST LORD and FIRST SEA LORD communicated orally to the Committee of Imperial Defence full details of the recommendations which they proposed to present to the forthcoming Naval Conference at Geneva with repre-sentatives of the United States of America and Japan on the subject of the reduction and limitation of Naval Armaments. They laid stress on the importance of their being in a position to lay these proposals before the Conference without any preliminary publicity. They therefore asked for the observance of strict secrecy.A discussion followed.The Committee of Imperial Defence agreed to recommend 1. The adoption of the Admiralty's proposals as the basis of the British Delegation^ negotiations at the forthcoming Conference at Geneva, and that the British Delegates should be given a reasonable latitude in regard to details.2. That the Dominion Representatives should be invited to attend a preliminary Conference in London to be held during the week immediately preceding the date fixed for the Conference at Geneva.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W. 1, May 20, 1927.* Full details of the Naval proposals and fuller Minutes will be circulated as soon as the need for close secrecy has passed. ; .
